poem:
**Morning Headlines**

Biden, our steady lighthouse,
says he's given heart and soul,
passing torches like heirlooms.
The dawn cracks open, urging us
to heed Harris, to cradle democracy.
Meanwhile, the fashion blog closes,
crisp and self-assured,
like a citizenry dawning
upon its future wardrobe.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Biden says he gave ‘heart and soul to our nation’ as he passes torch – as it happened 7.04am BST With that important DNC fashion news, this blog is closing. You can read our full story on Biden’s speech at the link below: Related: Biden urges voters to elect Harris in order to ‘preserve democracy’ in hopeful speech 7.02am BST It is a truth universally acknowledged that a prominent female politician in possession of a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
